message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the use of memristor-based neural networks for on-chip neuromorphic computing systems, which falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also focuses on the challenges of training imprecise memristor networks, which relates to the sub-category of cs.ET (Emerging Technologies). Additionally, the paper proposes a learning scheme that involves stochastic sparse updating and momentum adaptation, which falls under the sub-category of cs.AR (Hardware Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of network re-initialization and update compensation strategies, which relate to the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed scheme in terms of classification accuracy and convergence rate, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning).
